summary: Switch the payment experience from QR-based to UPI-ID-based, enhance the BUY flow with a duration (days) selection UI and a more premium look, then show copyable UPI ID and WhatsApp/Discord payment confirmation options; update Discord invite link to https://discord.gg/black-exe; remove the Dark/Light mode feature and keep the entire UI in a dark-only palette (dark black/dark gray/dark blue) across all sections as part of the premium redesign; update panel catalog/pricing by discounting INTERNAL and AIMBOT VISIBLE to match BASIC pricing and add a new panel named SILENT AIM KRIPTON with specified prices.
architectural_notes: External purchase flow via WhatsApp deep-link to +923137863480 with prefilled message including selected panel name.
Site visual direction: fully dark cyberpunk/hacker UI with neon blue/purple glow, glassmorphism panels, and hover glow animations.
Discord invite link placeholder must be replaced with the real server invite URL.
Prefer in-place content reveal for dashboard subsections (tabs/accordion/modal) rather than scroll-to behavior when users click dashboard buttons.
Dashboard/section content should remain collapsed by default and only reveal/activate on button click; avoid showing all subsections just by scrolling; maintain premium UI styling.
Discord invite link constant should be set to: https://discord.gg/black-exe and used everywhere (Contact + Dashboard Support/Payment).
Payment flow change: remove QR image-based payment and use UPI ID 9352000693@axl instead, with a copy-to-clipboard control.
On BUY NOW (or in-dashboard Payment), show UPI ID first and provide WhatsApp/Discord actions for payment confirmation/proof submission.

Enhance panel BUY interaction to include an in-UI duration selection step (buttons) before showing UPI payment details and confirmation actions; keep styling premium and consistent with the cyberpunk/glass UI.
Theme direction change: remove Dark/Light mode support; keep a single dark-only palette using dark black/dark gray/dark blue across the entire UI.
known_issues: Dashboard content currently appears while scrolling instead of being activated only on button click (should be collapsed/toggled).
Payment currently uses QR image(s); must be removed and replaced with copyable UPI ID 9352000693@axl.
Discord invite link must be updated to https://discord.gg/black-exe.
Some on-page text is not readable/visible due to current color/contrast choices; needs contrast/typography fixes across the UI.
Deployment/build is failing; investigate and fix deployment pipeline/build errors.
Pricing for new panel “SILENT AIM KRIPTON” includes two different entries for “7 DAY” (250 and 500); duration/label needs clarification before implementation.

existing_features.title: Create a single-page responsive marketing website for “BLACK EXE OFFICIAL PANEL STORE” (owner name: BLACK EXE) with a fully dark cyberpunk/hacker UI style: dark/black background, neon blue & purple glow accents, bold futuristic gaming typography, glassmorphism panels (blurred translucent cards), and hover glow animations on cards and buttons.

Implement the Home/Hero section with the exact headline and subtext:
- Main heading: “BLACK EXE OFFICIAL PANEL STORE”
- Sub text: “CHEAP & PREMIUM GAMING PANELS”

Add a “Panels” section containing 10 bold glowing glass cards (one per panel): BASIC, BRUTAL, PREMIUM, AIMKILL, SILENT AIM, AIMBOT VISIBLE, INTERNAL, UID BYPASS, STREAMER, SILENT AIM COVER. Each card must display its price list (1 DAY, 2 DAYS, 7 DAYS, 1 MONTH, PERMANENT) exactly as provided in INR.

Implement the buy flow: each panel card and its bold glowing “BUY NOW” button must link to WhatsApp number +923137863480 with a prefilled message exactly: “Hello BLACK EXE, I want to buy [Panel Name]” where [Panel Name] is replaced by the clicked panel’s name. Ensure the link properly URL-encodes spaces and special characters.

Add a bold neon “Pricing Table” section that consolidates all durations and prices for all panels into a readable table (mobile-friendly: allow horizontal scroll or convert to stacked rows/cards on small screens).

Add a Contact section with two big glowing buttons:
1) WhatsApp button showing the label “WHATSAPP: +923137863480” linking to the WhatsApp chat.
2) Discord button showing the label “DISCORD: <real invite link>” with a Discord icon and neon glow effect.
The Discord link must not use the placeholder URL; implement the invite URL as a single configurable constant so it can be replaced easily without hunting through the UI code.
Add the footer with the exact text: “© 2026 BLACK EXE – ALL RIGHTS RESERVED”.

Integrate generated brand assets as static images in the frontend (place them under frontend/public/assets/generated) and use them in the UI:
- Use the logo image in the header/hero area.
- Use the banner image as a hero background or prominent top banner element (without making text unreadable).

Add a new “Dashboard” section to the existing single-page site (without removing the current Hero, Panels, Pricing Table, Contact, and Footer sections). The Dashboard must visually match the current dark cyberpunk/glassmorphism style and be responsive.

Inside the Dashboard, implement 3–4 clear subsections (cards or tabs) with English labels. Include at minimum: “Panels”, “Profile Changer”, and “Support”. Add one additional section of your choice (e.g., “Status” or “FAQ”) but keep it informational only (no new purchase logic).

Make the Dashboard subsections navigable within the page: clicking a Dashboard item must scroll to (or reveal) its corresponding content block within the Dashboard section. For “Panels”, link/scroll to the existing “AVAILABLE PANELS” section or provide a clear in-dashboard shortcut that takes the user there.
Add a new in-dashboard "Payment" experience that lets users pay via QR code and then send payment proof via WhatsApp or Discord, without requiring the user to scroll to another section.
Use the two uploaded images (image.png and image-1.png) as the payment QR visuals and integrate them as static frontend assets, displayed responsively with a cyberpunk/glass UI frame.

Implement "Send Payment Proof" buttons that open WhatsApp and Discord with clear English prefilled guidance for what proof to send; WhatsApp deep-link must use the existing WhatsApp number constant (+923137863480) and must URL-encode the message.

Change the Dashboard behavior so clicking Dashboard items opens/reveals content in-place (tabs/accordion) and does not auto-scroll the page downward; keep an optional explicit "Go to Available Panels" button/link for users who still want to jump to the Panels section.
Fix Dashboard "Support" links to use the configured constants and the correct WhatsApp number/Discord invite URL (no hardcoded placeholder numbers/links).
Update the in-dashboard Payment UI to display only ONE QR code and remove/hide any additional QR code(s). Keep the remaining QR responsive, centered, and inside the existing cyberpunk/glass UI frame.

Change the overall single-page layout so that each major area is in its own separate section that does NOT all appear just by scrolling. Only the selected section should be active/visible when the user clicks its button/tab (e.g., Home, Dashboard, Available Panels, Pricing Table, Contact).

Polish the UI to feel more premium while keeping the existing dark cyberpunk/glassmorphism style (neon accents, glow states, consistent spacing/typography). Apply the premium styling consistently to the new section navigation and to the Payment tab content.
Update the in-dashboard Payment QR display so the full QR image is always visible (not cropped or partially hidden) on all screen sizes, while keeping the existing cyberpunk/glass UI frame styling.

Integrate the newly uploaded QR image file (image-2.png) as the single Payment QR asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and update the Payment UI to use this file as the displayed/enlarged QR image source.

Update the configured Discord invite URL constant to exactly "https://discord.gg/black-exe" and ensure all Discord links across the site (Contact section, Dashboard Support, Payment panel) use this constant (no hardcoded or outdated Discord URLs).

Remove the QR-code image payment UI from the Dashboard Payment experience and replace it with a UPI-ID-based payment UI that displays the UPI ID "9352000693@axl" and provides a clear copy-to-clipboard control. All user-facing text in this Payment UI must be in English.

Change the panel "BUY NOW" interaction so that when a user clicks BUY NOW (or clicks a panel card), the app shows the UPI payment details (UPI ID and copy action) and provides WhatsApp/Discord options to confirm payment—without immediately opening WhatsApp for purchase. The confirmation options must remain available via buttons/links in the payment view.

When a user clicks a panel card or the “BUY NOW” button, show a duration selection UI (as buttons) before proceeding with the payment/confirmation view. The duration options must match the durations already defined for the selected panel (e.g., “1 DAY”, “2 DAYS”, “7 DAYS”, “1 MONTH”, “PERMANENT”).

Update the PaymentPanel to support the duration-first purchase flow: (1) select duration, (2) show copyable UPI ID, (3) provide WhatsApp and Discord buttons to confirm payment. All user-facing text introduced or changed for this flow must be in English and the overall styling must be improved to look more premium while maintaining the existing cyberpunk/glassmorphism theme.

Include the selected duration (and, if available, the selected price amount) in the prefilled WhatsApp payment-proof message generated for the payment confirmation button, while keeping proper URL encoding and continuing to use the configured WhatsApp number constant.
Add a Dark/Light mode toggle control that allows the user to switch the entire site between dark mode and light mode without breaking existing section navigation or layouts.

Implement a complete light theme alongside the existing dark theme by defining light-mode design tokens (colors, borders, surfaces, text) and updating the app to use theme-aware tokens instead of hard-coded black/white backgrounds where applicable.

Overhaul the entire frontend UI to a more premium design while preserving the existing cyberpunk/glassmorphism identity and keeping all current features and flows intact (section navigation, dashboard tabs, panel selection → duration selection → UPI copy → WhatsApp/Discord confirmation).

Update the app’s theme palettes so that Dark Mode uses a black base with blue and red accents, and Light Mode uses a white base with gray and light-black tones, applied consistently across the entire site (header, section navigation, hero, dashboard, panels, pricing table, contact, payment modal/panel).
Refresh the global premium cyberpunk styling utilities to match the new palette (glass surfaces, neon glow, hover glow, focus rings, gradients) and ensure they are theme-aware (dark vs light).
Redesign the core layout components (SiteHeader + SectionNavigation) to look more premium while keeping the existing section-switching behavior intact and responsive on mobile.
Redesign Dashboard UI (tab cards + active content panels) to match the new premium theme, with improved active/hover states and clearer visual grouping for content blocks.

Add a new user-facing function: a Panels search + quick filter experience that lets users find panels by name and optionally filter by duration availability, without changing any prices or panel definitions.

Add a new user-facing function: persist the last selected panel + duration in the purchase flow so that if the user reopens the payment panel/modal, the previous selection is restored (per device/browser).
Remove the Light/Dark mode feature so the site always renders in a single dark-only theme (dark black, dark gray, dark blue).
Update the header to remove the theme toggle button and any theme-toggle related user-facing strings.
Make the HTML boot logic always start in dark-only mode and remove any pre-render logic that selects light mode based on system preference.

Refactor global theme tokens and utilities to be dark-only by removing the light theme variable set and eliminating `.dark`-scoped overrides, while keeping the cyberpunk/glass/neon styling in a dark black/gray/dark blue palette.

Redesign the site UI to look more premium with a darker, cleaner cyberpunk palette (dark black/dark gray/dark blue) and consistent spacing/typography across all sections (Header, Section Navigation, Hero, Dashboard, Panels, Pricing Table, Contact, Payment modal).
Fix site-wide text readability/visibility issues by improving contrast, font sizing, line-height, and background overlays wherever text is hard to see (especially over images and glass panels).
Replace the current site logo and banner with new premium versions and update the UI to use the new asset filenames (do not reduce hero text readability when applying the new banner).
Audit and correct any conflicting/unused global theme styling so the app consistently renders in the intended dark-only theme without accidental light-theme tokens affecting contrast.

Update the site’s typography colors so that general text renders in a light white or light gray style across all sections (Header, Section Navigation, Hero, Dashboard, Panels, Pricing Table, Contact, PaymentPanel), while keeping the existing dark-only cyberpunk theme and neon accents for headings/active states.

Refine the global theme tokens and/or shared CSS utilities to enforce the new light white/light gray typography defaults (e.g., adjust the global foreground and muted-foreground values and ensure commonly used text utility classes map to those tokens).

Update the Dashboard section so that no dashboard content panel is visible by default; only the dashboard tab buttons should be visible initially, and a tab’s content must appear only after the user clicks that tab button.

Fix Dashboard typography colors so that all text rendered in the Dashboard section (including tab labels, panel headings, body text, and any supporting labels) uses white/light-gray readable text on the dark theme, and no dashboard text renders as black.
Investigate the current deployment failure and implement the minimal code/config changes required so the project builds and deploys successfully on the Internet Computer.

Remove or fix any build-breaking placeholders, dead imports, or empty modules that can cause TypeScript bundling/compilation failures (for example, empty component files or unused imports that break the build when referenced).

Ensure the project has all required deployment/build configuration files present and correctly referenced by the build system (for example, canister/frontend build configuration), and fix any missing/misnamed file references that prevent deployment.

Update the frontend styling so that any user-visible text currently rendering as black is changed to render as white or light gray across the entire site (Header, Section Navigation, Hero, Dashboard, Panels, Pricing Table, Contact, and Payment UI). Prefer using the existing theme tokens/classes (`text-foreground` for primary text and `text-muted-foreground` for secondary text) instead of hard-coded `text-black`/`#000` values.

Update the section navigation behavior so the app does NOT show all major sections on the Home page by scrolling. On initial load, only the Home/Hero section must be visible. Other major sections (Dashboard, Available Panels, Pricing Table, Contact) must remain hidden/inactive until the user clicks the corresponding navigation button, at which point only that selected section becomes visible.

Add animated typography effects for headings (animated font/glow/motion) while keeping readability and the existing premium dark cyberpunk theme. Apply the animation at minimum to the Hero headline and Hero subtext, and ensure the animation respects reduced-motion preferences.

Update the panel purchase flow UI to a step-by-step wizard shown after a user clicks a panel card or the “Buy Now” button: Step 1 = duration selection (show only available durations for the selected panel) with a “Next” button; Step 2 = payment method/details (show copyable UPI ID) with a “Next” button; Step 3 = payment proof/confirmation options (WhatsApp + Discord buttons/links). All wizard user-facing text must be in English.

Refactor the existing PaymentPanel component to support explicit wizard step state (Duration → Payment → Proof) while preserving existing functionality: restore last selected duration only when valid for the currently selected panel; keep UPI ID copy behavior; keep WhatsApp proof link generation using the existing utility.
Replace the current site logo and hero banner assets with newly generated premium versions and update the frontend to use the new filenames without reducing hero text readability.

Update the site footer to match the previously requested exact text requirement by displaying ONLY: “© 2026 BLACK EXE – ALL RIGHTS RESERVED” (no dynamic year, no additional referral links, and no extra footer content).

Update the Dashboard section so that no dashboard tab content panel is visible by default; only the dashboard tab buttons should be visible initially, and a tab’s content must appear only after the user clicks that tab button.
Investigate and fix the current deployment/build failure by applying the minimal code/config changes required so the project builds and deploys successfully on the Internet Computer.

Update the panel catalog pricing so that the panels named "INTERNAL" and "AIMBOT VISIBLE" have the exact same prices as the "BASIC" panel for all durations that BASIC supports (1 DAY, 2 DAYS, 7 DAYS, 1 MONTH, PERMANENT).

Add a new panel entry to the panel catalog with name "SILENT AIM KRIPTON" and include it everywhere panels are rendered (Available Panels grid, search/filter, and the Pricing Table). Use the exact prices provided by the user for the durations they specified.

Resolve the conflicting/duplicate duration provided for "SILENT AIM KRIPTON" before shipping: the user specified two different prices for "7 DAY" (250 and 500). Implement the new panel with a single, unambiguous set of duration keys (matching the site’s duration labels, e.g., "7 DAYS"), and ensure no panel contains duplicate duration entries in its prices array.
